intro: Trichinium fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's trichinium, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Trichinium fraseri is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
